title: How hard is it to integrate credit cards with mobiles? If not hard, why don’t credit card companies or any startups make it popular? If it’s hard, what is hard? - Quora

response.answer_text: Well, we can add our own credit cards to our iPhone Wallet and use that to pay at restaurants, stores, etc. We can add a PayPal, Stripe, Square, or other dongle to a smartphone and process a charge by swiping someone else’s card. So we can purchase and charge to our own credit card using a smartphone, and we can charge other people’s credit cards using a smartphone. Sounds pretty integrated to me.
Mobile devices have many flaws. Just to name a few: Security issues;Not able to issue paper receipts;Dependent on cellular signal
